data.title: February 23, 2014
data.text:
Celebrate The 15 Year Anniversary Of The Roots’ ‘Things Fall Apart’ With Chill Moody’s “nicethings Fall Apart” Tribute

West Philly Native Pays Homage To Hometown Forebears With New Release Visit streaming.thesource.com for more information Advertisement This week The Roots made history once again when they joined Jimmy Fallon as the house band on NBC’s “The Tonight Show”. Return to The Fifth Dynasty: A Look Back At “Things Fall Apart”

Visit streaming.thesource.com for more information “Inevitably, hip-hop records are treated as though they are disposable. They are not maximized as product, not to mention as art,” concludes “Act Won,” the foreboding intro track from Things Fall Apart. It sets the stage for the brooding assault on mainstream industry and the self-referential rumination on Black culture that is […]

Ferragamo Presents Its Women’s FW14 Runway Collection

Today in Milan on Feb. 23, Massimiliano Giornetti debuted the Ferragamo FW14 runway collection, unveiling the House’s new premiere handbag, FIAMMA, inspired by the Ferragamo female legacy.

Jason Collins Is Set To Sign With The Brooklyn Nets

Visit streaming.thesource.com for more information Full-circle In 2001, with the 18th pick in the NBA Draft, the New Jersey Nets selected Jason Collins, the tall, lanky center out of Stanford University. Collins played off the bench, and started a significant amount of games, and was an important part of the Net’s NBA Finals run the […]

The MLB To Present Diversity Business Summit

Major League Baseball announced that it will partner with the New York Yankees to co-host the 2014 MLB Diversity Business Summit, “which will provide attendees with unprecedented access to human resource and procurement executives from all 30 MLB Clubs, MLB Network, MLB Advanced Media, Minor League Baseball Clubs and MLB’s Central Office, in New York […]

Jeremy Scott as creative director of Moschino presented his first collection for the Italian Fashion House in Milan on February 20.
